content:
er 18, 2016
												This game is pretty fun. I was surprised when I found out you had to jump in the game, something that is super challenging and on the fringe of frustrating, however. Be prepared to get a work out with this one. There is lots of crouching, jumping and just moving around in general. The visuals are not all that impressive, as the lasers look more like red Liquorice than they do laser beams.I can still recommend the game as it is something different and the first of its kind (I am unaware of any other laser dodging game). One could argue for perhaps a cheaper price too, maybe $5-7.My overviews: 


YouTube™ Video: CAN'T TOUCH THE LASERS | Doomsday Survival Gameplay (HTC Vive VR) 

			Views: 115		

			Laser dodging has never been this much fun! Or tiring... I was surprised to find out that you even have to jump in this game!

content:
er 9, 2016
												Such a simple idea, but there is really some fun in this game.+ Simple idea+ Graphics are ok+ Nice exercise (not as exhausting as Holopoint)- Could have more levels, there is content for 2-4 hoursThis is the first VR game I played where jumping is part of the game. A great idea, but... I stood on the cable smashing the headset on the floor. And several times the headset fell from my head. I rammed the controllers into the ceiling. My neighbours beneath me asked what I was doing. So my final points:+ Vive is really stable, can be smashed onto the floor- Jumping in VR games, is not a good idea-> All in all: it's worth 10$, I would buy it again.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
er 17, 2016
												I like the concept of this game; it explores some great ideas few other VR games do. That said, it seems like the developers never actually played through the game they shipped. There are levels impossible to complete without abusing the Steam overlay to pause the game (12), levels impossible to three-star due to coins that can't be reached without dying (14), levels impossible to complete because they kill you partway through for no apparent reason (15)... and that's as far as I felt like playing. I could look past the low-budget graphics and sound, but it's hard to look past such sloppy game design.
